## ItemTreeManager.addFieldHook() method

Add a patch hook for `getField`<!-- -->, which is called when custom cell is rendered(and in many other cases).

Don't patch a Zotero's built-in field.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
addFieldHook(dataKey: string, fieldHook: (field: string, unformatted: boolean, includeBaseMapped: boolean, item: Zotero.Item, original: Function) => string): Promise<void>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  dataKey | string | Cell <code>dataKey</code>, e.g. 'title' |
|  fieldHook | (field: string, unformatted: boolean, includeBaseMapped: boolean, item: Zotero.Item, original: Function) =&gt; string | patch hook |

<b>Returns:</b>

Promise&lt;void&gt;

## Remarks

Don't call it manually unless you understand what you are doing.
